text: Functions of glutathione and glutathione disulfide in immunology and immunopathology .

Even a moderate increase in the cellular cysteine supply elevates the intracellular glutathione ( GSH ) and glutathione disulfide ( GSSG ) levels and potentiates immunological functions of lymphocytes in vitro .
At low GSSG levels , T cells can not optimally activate the immunologically important transcription factor NF kappa B , whereas high GSSG levels inhibit the DNA binding activity of NF kappa B .
The effects of GSSG are antagonized by reduced <extra_id_0> thioredoxin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TRX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

As the protein tyrosine kinase activities <extra_id_0> p56lck <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p59fyn <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are activated in intact cells by hydrogen peroxide , they are likely targets for GSSG action .

text: These redox - regulated enzymes trigger signal cascades for NF kappa B activation and transduce signals from the T cell antigen receptor , from <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and CD8 molecules , and from the <extra_id_0> IL-2 receptor beta-chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The effector phase of cytotoxic T cell responses and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent functions are inhibited even by a partial depletion of the intracellular GSH pool .

As signal transduction is facilitated by prooxidant conditions , we propose that the well-known immunological consequences of GSH depletion ultimately may be results of the accompanying GSSG deficiency .

As HIV-infected patients and SIV-infected rhesus macaques have , on the average , significantly decreased plasma cyst ( e ) ine and intracellular GSH levels , we also hypothesize that AIDS may be the consequence of a GSSG deficiency as well .
